channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft Corporation -- ChakraCore, Microsoft Edge
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft Corporation -- ChakraCore, Microsoft Edge

item.title: CVE-2018-0933|2024-08-05T03:44:11.625Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- chakracore%2C%20microsoft%20edge
item.description: ChakraCore and Microsoft Windows 10 Gold, 1511, 1607, 1703, 1709, and Windows Server 2016 allows remote code execution, due to how the Chakra scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Chakra Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0872, CVE-2018-0873, CVE-2018-0874, CVE-2018-0930, CVE-2018-0931, CVE-2018-0934, CVE-2018-0936, and CVE-2018-0937.

This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0873, CVE-2018-0874, CVE-2018-0930, CVE-2018-0931, CVE-2018-0933, CVE-2018-0934, CVE-2018-0936, and CVE-2018-0937.

item.title: CVE-2018-0939|2024-08-05T03:44:11.651Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- chakracore%2C%20microsoft%20edge
item.description: ChakraCore and Microsoft Edge in Windows 10 1703 and 1709 allow information disclosure, due to how the scripting engine handles objects in memory, aka "Scripting Engine Information Disclosure Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2018-0891.
